connector.description: Interact with Ethereum nodes using web3j client API.

camel.sink.path.nodeAddress.name: camel.sink.path.nodeAddress
camel.sink.path.nodeAddress.description: Sets the node address used to communicate

camel.sink.endpoint.addresses.name: camel.sink.endpoint.addresses
camel.sink.endpoint.addresses.description: Contract address or a list of addresses.

camel.sink.endpoint.fromAddress.name: camel.sink.endpoint.fromAddress
camel.sink.endpoint.fromAddress.description: The address the transaction is send from

camel.sink.endpoint.fromBlock.name: camel.sink.endpoint.fromBlock
camel.sink.endpoint.fromBlock.description: The block number, or the string latest for the last mined block or pending, earliest for not yet mined transactions.

camel.sink.endpoint.fullTransactionObjec.name: camel.sink.endpoint.fullTransactionObjects
camel.sink.endpoint.fullTransactionObjec.description: If true it returns the full transaction objects, if false only the hashes of the transactions.

camel.sink.endpoint.gasLimit.name: camel.sink.endpoint.gasLimit
camel.sink.endpoint.gasLimit.description: The maximum gas allowed in this block.

camel.sink.endpoint.privateFor.name: camel.sink.endpoint.privateFor
camel.sink.endpoint.privateFor.description: A transaction privateFor nodes with public keys in a Quorum network

camel.sink.endpoint.quorumAPI.name: camel.sink.endpoint.quorumAPI
camel.sink.endpoint.quorumAPI.description: If true, this will support Quorum API.

camel.sink.endpoint.toAddress.name: camel.sink.endpoint.toAddress
camel.sink.endpoint.toAddress.description: The address the transaction is directed to.

camel.sink.endpoint.toBlock.name: camel.sink.endpoint.toBlock
camel.sink.endpoint.toBlock.description: The block number, or the string latest for the last mined block or pending, earliest for not yet mined transactions.

camel.sink.endpoint.topics.name: camel.sink.endpoint.topics
camel.sink.endpoint.topics.description: Topics are order-dependent. Each topic can also be a list of topics. Specify multiple topics separated by comma.

camel.sink.endpoint.atBlock.name: camel.sink.endpoint.atBlock
camel.sink.endpoint.atBlock.description: The block number, or the string latest for the last mined block or pending, earliest for not yet mined transactions.

camel.sink.endpoint.blockHash.name: camel.sink.endpoint.blockHash
camel.sink.endpoint.blockHash.description: Hash of the block where this transaction was in.

camel.sink.endpoint.clientId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.clientId
camel.sink.endpoint.clientId.description: A random hexadecimal(32 bytes) ID identifying the client.

camel.sink.endpoint.data.name: camel.sink.endpoint.data
camel.sink.endpoint.data.description: The compiled code of a contract OR the hash of the invoked method signature and encoded parameters.

camel.sink.endpoint.gasPrice.name: camel.sink.endpoint.gasPrice
camel.sink.endpoint.gasPrice.description: Gas price used for each paid gas.

camel.sink.endpoint.hashrate.name: camel.sink.endpoint.hashrate
camel.sink.endpoint.hashrate.description: A hexadecimal string representation (32 bytes) of the hash rate.

camel.sink.endpoint.headerPowHash.name: camel.sink.endpoint.headerPowHash
camel.sink.endpoint.headerPowHash.description: The header's pow-hash (256 bits) used for submitting a proof-of-work solution.

camel.sink.endpoint.index.name: camel.sink.endpoint.index
camel.sink.endpoint.index.description: The transactions/uncle index position in the block.

camel.sink.endpoint.keyName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keyName
camel.sink.endpoint.keyName.description: The key name in the database.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.mixDigest.name: camel.sink.endpoint.mixDigest
camel.sink.endpoint.mixDigest.description: The mix digest (256 bits) used for submitting a proof-of-work solution.

camel.sink.endpoint.nonce.name: camel.sink.endpoint.nonce
camel.sink.endpoint.nonce.description: The nonce found (64 bits) used for submitting a proof-of-work solution.

camel.sink.endpoint.position.name: camel.sink.endpoint.position
camel.sink.endpoint.position.description: The transaction index position withing a block.

camel.sink.endpoint.priority.name: camel.sink.endpoint.priority
camel.sink.endpoint.priority.description: The priority of a whisper message.

camel.sink.endpoint.sha3HashOfDataToSign.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sha3HashOfDataToSign
camel.sink.endpoint.sha3HashOfDataToSign.description: Message to sign by calculating an Ethereum specific signature.

camel.sink.endpoint.signedTransactionDat.name: camel.sink.endpoint.signedTransactionData
camel.sink.endpoint.signedTransactionDat.description: The signed transaction data for a new message call transaction or a contract creation for signed transactions.

camel.sink.endpoint.transactionHash.name: camel.sink.endpoint.transactionHash
camel.sink.endpoint.transactionHash.description: The information about a transaction requested by transaction hash.

camel.sink.endpoint.ttl.name: camel.sink.endpoint.ttl
camel.sink.endpoint.ttl.description: The time to live in seconds of a whisper message.

camel.sink.endpoint.value.name: camel.sink.endpoint.value
camel.sink.endpoint.value.description: The value sent within a transaction.

By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. camel.component.web3j.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.web3j.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.web3j.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
